page.title: 13The Oil Pipeline,Marchwood
page.content: Esso, the oil company,is building a pipeline from Fawley to the Midlands to carry jet fuel.It will pass through farmland close to Marchwood.It is costing Â£40 million to build and it will be just 30 centimetres in diameter.It is being laid in a trench two to three metres deep.The complete length will be 210 kilometres. Negotiations between the oil company and local landowners lasted for over two years before the line was started.The joints are being tested by X-rays because a leak could release thousands of gallons of fuel that could ruin the land for hundreds of years.At the moment the route of the pipeline looks very ugly, but the oil company has promised that when the project is completed,no visible sign of the pipeline will remain.
